result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel T Littleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Amended to reflect Count one is a Class B Felony
Amended to reflect Joint and Several Restitution

superMiscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
  No contact directly or indirectly with Demon Smith, Richard Pocian, Nikki Casabaum, William Abrashinsky

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Petition for review is denied
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Supreme Court. It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose. Indigency may be reevaulated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied. The 30-day period in which to file a peitition for review may not be enlarged.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but noncomorming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of WIS STAT 809.62(2)(2) and (4) must be filed with the clerk of this circuit court by January 5, 2018.

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Andrew H Morgan is relieved from further representing Israel T. Littleton in this appeal.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
